info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 1:02PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Ripley and central Butler Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 102 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dalton, or 12 miles northwest of Pocahontas, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Doniphan around 120 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Oxly, Naylor, Fairdealing, Milltown, Harviell and Poplar Bluff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for southeastern Missouri.
